intro: Gomphostemma pedunculatum, commonly known as the winged milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves that are often winged or ribbed. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. Gomphostemma pedunculatum is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wetlands.
